titleStmt.title: Copper Plate Grant of Pallava Viṣṇugōpavarman, Year 1

availability.licence: Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 3.0 licence.

support.p: Four playes. Each of the plates is 18.6 cm long and 6.5 cm wide. They are passed through an oval-shaped ring, the ends of which are soldered to a low-based seal. The set weighs 622 gms with the seal, and the seal weights 277.100 gms.

origin.origPlace: Kurnool, immediately below the preceding inscription.

history.provenance: Alavakoṇḍa, in the Sanjamala mandal, Kurnool district, Andhra Pradesh.

div.p: This edition is based on Reddy and Krishna Reddy 2000. Emendations by Andrew Ollett on the basis of the plates provided in that article.

div.ab:
siddhaṃ || vijayathāṇā mahārājassa appadihatasāsaṇassa sāma
ntavinītavikrātayasassa aṇēkahiraṇṇakoṭigohalasata
sahassa patāyiṇo bhāraddāyasagōttassa pallavāṇaṃ siri buddhavammassa
puttō bhagavatā nārāyaṇasamapātaparigahītassa bhāraddāya sagōtta

ssa pallavāṇaṃ mahārāja siri viṣṇugōpassa vacanēna
kasa
vva bhōjakā savvaṇōttiri puttā gāmā gāma bhōjaka mutuda mudirika
ammacō ārakṣika vācanā vallava talavara mādapika kulputtaka ya bha
vissa mahāpurasā sañcarantakā bhatta maṇusā ava matikā bhāṇitā

pandhājanām cirippālikārajje mimalaraṭṭhe gāmo khaṇhaṇappā kuṇḍūra a
mhēhi appaṇō kulagōtta buddhavammā avaṭṭhaṇīkaṃ vijayavijaṇi
yā kātaṇajāmassē bamhaṇassa kaṇvasagōttassa sivandajja
ssa ayandatārakaṃ bamhadijjaṃ kāttaṇa danakānika saṃppatattō tatēva

cātvajjam agnahēva bamhaṇajja savva parihārēhim pariharadha pari
harā cōdhayye cata sāsaṇam atitāmidi kulōbhēṇa mānēna vā
pīrdā pādākarēti kāriti vāsōkhu sa punnē ggahaṇa sāsana cōtthi

tpaṇa devā bujja parihārēdha parihārāvēdha ya taja ca aṇṇō
masam alōṇa khārikam araṭṭha samviṇāyikam apārapa
gōbalivadam acōllaka cāṭa bhaṭa ppavēsam ahiraktika

sampadattā paṭikā savaccharam padhamam hēmanta pakhē padhamō diva
ñcamī 5 || bahubhivvasudhā dattā bahubhiscānupālitā yasya yasya ya
dā bhūmistasya tasya tadāphalam || svadattām paradattām vā yō harēta vasu
ndharām gavāśata sahasrasya hantyaḥ harē duṣkrutam || iti svasti ||
